Instrument_Host_PDS3.instrument_host_desc:
Instrument Host Overview ========================
The following information comes from the NRAO website (http://www.nrao.edu):
The National Radio Astronomy Observatory (NRAO) 'is funded by the National Science Foundation (NSF) under the terms of a cooperative agreement between the NSF and Associated Universities, Inc. (AUI), a science management corporation.'
'The NRAO operates a complementary suite of powerful telescopes for exploring the Universe: - Robert C. Byrd Green Bank Telescope (GBT), the world's most sensitive single-dish radio telescope. - Very Large Array (VLA), an array of 27 radio telescopes that is among the most productive research tools in astronomy. - Very Long Baseline Array (VLBA), an array of 10 radio telescopes and the highest resolution astronomical telescope.'
The GBT, located in Green Bank, West Virginia, was used as the radar receiver for all of the lunar maps archived here.
See 'Observing With The Green Bank Telescope' [MINTER2010] for more information on the NRAO's Green Bank telescope.
